tool.name: OGS: convertGEO
tool.description: Galaxy wrapper for the OGS utility 'convertGEO'.
tool.command: for i in $input_file; do if [ "$i" != "None" ] && [ ! -e "$(basename $i)" ]; then ln -s "$i" "$(basename $i)"; fi; done; for i in $gmsh_path; do if [ "$i" != "None" ] && [ ! -e "$(basename $i)" ]; then ln -s "$i" "$(basename $i)"; fi; done; convertGEO --input-file '$input_file.element_identifier' #if str($gmsh_path).strip() != 'None' and str($gmsh_path).strip() != '': --gmsh-path '$gmsh_path.element_identifier' #end if --output-file output_1.vtu

param.name: input_file
param.label: input file
param.help: Input (.gml|.gli). the geometry file to be converted

param.name: gmsh_path
param.label: gmsh path
param.help: Input (.msh). The path to the gmsh binary file

tool.help: This tool runs the **convertGEO** utility from the OpenGeoSys suite.
